text.div:
Name Flags Card. Type Description & Constraints
Availability Σ TU Element Availability data for an {item}

Elements defined in Ancestors: id, extension
availableTime Σ C 0..* Element Times the {item} is available
+ Rule: Cannot include start/end times when selecting all day availability.

daysOfWeek Σ 0..* code mon | tue | wed | thu | fri | sat | sun
Binding: Days Of Week ( Required)

allDay Σ C 0..1 boolean Always available? i.e. 24 hour service
availableStartTime Σ C 0..1 time Opening time of day (ignored if allDay = true)
availableEndTime Σ C 0..1 time Closing time of day (ignored if allDay = true)
notAvailableTime Σ 0..* Element Not available during this time due to provided reason

description Σ 0..1 string Reason presented to the user explaining why time not available
during Σ 0..1 Period Service not available during this period

Documentation for this format

name: Availability
description: Availability Type: Availability data for an {item}.

element.short: Availability data for an {item}
element.definition: Availability data for an {item}.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.short: Additional content defined by implementations
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Times the {item} is available
element.definition: Times the {item} is available.
element.requirements: A collection of times that the {item} is available.

constraint.human: Cannot include start/end times when selecting all day availability.
constraint.expression: allDay.exists().not() or (allDay implies availableStartTime.exists().not() and availableEndTime.exists().not())

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.short: Additional content defined by implementations
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: mon | tue | wed | thu | fri | sat | sun
element.definition: mon | tue | wed | thu | fri | sat | sun.
element.requirements: Indicates which days of the week are available between the start and end Times.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

extension.valueString: The purpose for which an extended contact detail should be used.

binding.description: The purpose for which an extended contact detail should be used.

element.short: Always available? i.e. 24 hour service
element.definition: Always available? i.e. 24 hour service.
element.requirements: Is this always available? (hence times are irrelevant) i.e. 24 hour service.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Opening time of day (ignored if allDay = true)
element.definition: Opening time of day (ignored if allDay = true).
element.comment: The timezone is expected to be specified or implied by the context this datatype is used.
element.requirements: The opening time of day. Note: If the AllDay flag is set, then this time is ignored.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Closing time of day (ignored if allDay = true)
element.definition: Closing time of day (ignored if allDay = true).
element.comment: The timezone is expected to be specified or implied by the context this datatype is used.
element.requirements: The closing time of day. Note: If the AllDay flag is set, then this time is ignored.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Not available during this time due to provided reason
element.definition: Not available during this time due to provided reason.
element.requirements: The {item} is not available during this period of time due to the provided reason.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.short: Additional content defined by implementations
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Reason presented to the user explaining why time not available
element.definition: Reason presented to the user explaining why time not available.
element.comment:
The reason will generally be provided to give the textual reason for displaying when the {item} is not available, e.g. 'Closed public holidays' or 'Independence Day'. In cases such as this, the `during` might not be included and local knowledge would be required in such cases (as don't desire to keep updating when the holiday occurs each year).

e.g.2: 'Closed for maintenance over the summer' for this example you would want to include the `during` period, unless this was a university hospital and the "summer" period was well known, but would recommend its inclusion anyway.
element.requirements: The reason that can be presented to the user as to why this time is not available.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Service not available during this period
element.definition: Service not available during this period.
element.requirements: The {item} is not available (seasonally or for a public holiday) during this period.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Availability data for an {item}.

element.definition: Times the {item} is available.

element.short: Not available during this time due to provided reason
element.definition: Not available during this time due to provided reason.
element.requirements: The {item} is not available during this period of time due to the provided reason.

In cases such as this, the `during` might not be included and local knowledge would be required in such cases (as don't desire to keep updating when the holiday occurs each year).

e.g.2: 'Closed for maintenance over the summer' for this example you would want to include the `during` period, unless this was a university hospital and the "summer" period was well known, but would recommend its inclusion anyway.
